title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act is titled the "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" and includes a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for regulated facilities and vessels to specific committees and the Comptroller General within a year of the Act's enactment. The assessment will be conducted by a national laboratory or a maritime security university-based center with expertise in maritime security. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in addressing security risks in the maritime environment, addressing deficiencies, and conducting a cost-benefit analysis. A corrective action plan must be submitted within 60 days to specific committees for program reforms. The corrective action plan for the transportation security card program must be submitted within 60 days to specific committees for program reforms, including an implementation plan with benchmarks and potential programmatic reforms, revisions to regulations, or proposals for legislation. The Comptroller General will review the plan's implementation of recommendations from the assessment submitted by the national laboratory or maritime security university-based center. The corrective action plan for the transportation security card program must be submitted within 60 days to specific committees for program reforms, including an implementation plan with benchmarks and potential programmatic reforms, revisions to regulations, or proposals for legislation. The plan must address recommendations from the national laboratory or maritime security university-based center and the Comptroller General. The Secretary of Homeland Security cannot issue a final rule on transportation security card readers until the Comptroller General informs the relevant committees. The final rule on transportation security card readers is contingent upon the Comptroller General's recommendations being addressed and an updated list of compatible readers being issued by the Secretary. This rule does not apply to any final rule issued under the notice of proposed rulemaking on Transportation Worker. The Comptroller General will provide oversight on the implementation of the corrective action plan related to the Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC)-Reader Requirements final rule. Reports will be submitted to specific committees every six months for a 3-year period following the issuance of the first report. SEC. 3. NO ADDITIONAL FUNDS AUTHORIZED. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing available amounts.
